Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: எப்பொருள் யார்யார்வாய்க் கேட்பினும் அப்பொருள் மெய்ப்பொருள் காண்ப தறிவு.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: To discern the truth in every thing, by whomsoever spoken, is wisdom.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A wise person sits in a meditative posture at the center of a convergence of streams.
Layered_Composition.Midground: Various streams of information flow towards them from all directions, each stream representing different speakers ('யார்யார்வாய்') and different subjects ('எப்பொருள்'). The streams are murky and contain a mixture of silt (falsehood) and glowing golden particles (truth).
Layered_Composition.Background: As the murky streams reach the wise person, their mind acts as a filter. The silt and mud are discarded, and only the pure, glowing golden particles of truth ('மெய்ப்பொருள்') are absorbed, forming a radiant aura of pure wisdom ('அறிவு') around them.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: Wisdom is the ability to listen to all sources and on all subjects, but to filter out falsehood and discern the essential truth within.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The murky streams represent raw, unfiltered information. The wise person's mind as a filter is the key metaphor. The separated golden particles represent the discerned truth ('மெய்ப்பொருள்').
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The incoming streams are dull and murky. The central figure and the filtered golden truth glow with a brilliant, pure light. The palette moves from muddy to pure gold.

Technical_Cues.Camera: Top-down shot, showing the streams converging on the central figure and the filtering process.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, with complex fluid dynamics and particle effects.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: The primary light source is the glowing aura of truth being formed, which pushes back the murkiness.

Negative_Prompt: person drinking the murky water, no filtering process, dark aura, text artifacts, cartoonish.

Hyperparameters.seed: Explore variations for the filtering effect.
